title: Virginia law enforcement anti-Semitism training materials

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any materials (including slides, powerpoint presentations, handouts, flyers, or similar written material) distributed or presented during the October 1, 2024, Extremism & Hamas in the U.S. training, referenced in Gov. Youngkin's Oct. 22, 2024 tweet, available at https://twitter.com/GovernorVA/status/1848788953953882422. According to participants in the event, the event was co-organized by the Governor's office. See: https://combatantisemitism.org/cam-news/training-session-offers-virginia-law-enforcement-officers-lesson-on-hamas-threat-in-us. 

2. Any materials (including slides, powerpoint presentations, handouts, flyers, or similar written material) distributed or presented during the law enforcement training held in Blacksburg on or about December 9, 2024, as referenced in this tweet: https://x.com/CombatASemitism/status/1866427571866312839.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Lowell High School reassignment of student newspaper advisor

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The letter sent by the Journalism Education Association of Northern California concerning the reassignment of Eric Gustafson at Lowell High School.

2. Any communications sent to the Journalism Education Association of Northern California in response to the organization's letter.

3. Any communications sent or received by Jan Bautista, Isaac "Jandro" Alcantar, Chris Lanier, Abby Matthews, or Matt McDonell concerning the reassignment of Eric Gustafson relating to the student newspaper.

4. Any communications sent or received by Jan Bautista, Isaac "Jandro" Alcantar, Chris Lanier, Abby Matthews, or Matt McDonell mentioning any of the following terms: "prior restraint", "prior review", "newspaper", "The Lowell", "adviser", "advisor", "Leonard Law", or "Gustafson"

Requests 3 and 4 are limited to communications sent or received on or after October 1, 2024.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Applications to install license plate readers

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Applications to install license plate readers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any datasets, logs, or lists showing the State, local, and university Police agencies that have applied to the Georgia Department of Transportation for a permit to place an Automated License Plate Readers Device along the state’s right of way.

If this information is maintained in a spreadsheet, such as Excel, I request that the record be produced in this format. If datasets, logs or lists are not available, please provide the applications submitted to the Georgia Department of Transportation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper
